result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel G. Gomez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 2 days, if revoked.
Court will consider an expungement in 2 yrs upon DE submitting a request by letter as instructed by the Court.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:   AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not have contact with Adolfo Hernandez or Sebastian Castaneda, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel G. Gomez

records.addlTxt:
State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Attorney Patrick Michael Brady in court with Defendant Angel G. Gomez.   Clerk: PU  
 Minutes:  DE waives any conflict on proceeding before Judge Gabriele today.  Amended Info. filed and case is resolved.  Count 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Counts 1 & 3 - Dismissed and Read In.,  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to DE in court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 12 monts with conditions.  Credit for 2 days if revoked.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Court will consider an expungement in 2 years upon DE submitting a request by letter as instructed by the Court.  Appeal Rights given.
from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22

Defendant, Angel G. Gomez, appeared with Attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Angel G. Gomez, appeared with Attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Intern Daniel Bernard Deida with Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Brady requests brief adjournment.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
